GoalDescription: A dynamic public sector with good governance principles and strong institutions delivering the support and services expected by all citizens of Vanuatu
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Coordinate donor resources to align with national objectives
IndicatorDescription: Percentage of aid for the government sector using Vanuatu government PFM systems
ComputationMethod: Number of aids for the government sectors using Vanuatu government PFM systems.
Concept: PFM systems are essential for effective and sustainable economic management and public service delivery
DataSource:
* National Aid Agency (Administrative Data)
* Ministry of Foreign Affairs 
*Department of Finance & Treasury
Definition: Public Financial Management (PFM) is the system whereby financial resources are planned, directed and monitored for the efficient and effective implementation of public service objectives
IndicatorShortName: Foreign Aid to Government Using PFM Systems
Rationale: Effective delivery of public services is closely associated with poverty reduction and growth, and countries with strong, transparent, accountable PFM systems tend to deliver services more effectively and equitably and regulate markets more efficiently and fairly.
